TextView.android:text: Introduction to Paediatric Early Warning Signs Score (PEWS)\n

PEWS score is a validated objective tool that represent a “track-and-trigger system”;
 “Track” by identifying children at risk for clinical deterioration.
 “Trigger” by determining the action needed to prevent further deterioration.
 Benefits of using PEWS score includes;
 ● Improve clinical outcomes and hence reduce morbidity and mortality.
 ● Promote earlier intervention and transfer to Paediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU).
 ● Enhance multidisciplinary team working, communication, and confidence in recognising and making decisions about deteriorating children.
 PEWS score consists of selected age-appropriate routine parameters such as heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate, evidence of respiratory distress, temperature, oxygen saturation, and mental status. A higher PEWS indicates a worse clinical condition and should be followed up by early intervention by medical staff to prevent further deterioration.
 Reference
